verses.verse: The fifth angel blew his trumpet, and I saw a star fall from heaven to the earth, and the key to the bottomless pit was given to him.
He opened the bottomless pit, and smoke came up out of the pit, like the smoke of an enormous furnace. Then the sun and the air were darkened from the smoke of the pit.
Out of the smoke came locusts to the earth. Power was given to them, like the scorpions on the earth have power.
It was said to them that they must not hurt the earth's grass, any green plant, or any tree, but only those people who don't have the seal of God on their foreheads.
It was given to them that they shouldn't kill them, only that they should be tormented five months. Their torment [was] like a scorpion when it stings someone.
In those days people will seek death and not find it; they will want to die, and death will flee from them.
The locusts resembled horses prepared for battle. On their heads [were] what looked like gold crowns and their faces [looked] like human faces.
They had hair like women, and their teeth were like a lion's.
They had vests resembling iron vests; the sounds of their wings [were] like the noise of many horse-drawn chariots running to battle.
They had tails like scorpions, and there were stingers in their tails. Their power [was] to hurt men five months.
They had a king over them, the angel of the bottomless pit, whose name in Hebrew [is] Abaddon but in Greek has the name, Apollyon.
One horror is over, [but] look there are two more to come!
The sixth angel blew his trumpet, then I heard a voice from the four corners of the gold altar which is in front of God,
saying to the sixth angel who had the trumpet, "Loosen the four angels who are tied up at the great river Euphrates."
These four angels were made ready for this hour, day, month, and year to kill one third of humanity.
The number of the army of the horsemen [was] two hundred million; I heard their number.

And this is how I saw the horses in the vision and those who sat on them. [They] had vests of fire (red), jacinth (deep purple), and sulfur (yellow). The horse's heads [were] like lion's heads, and out of their mouths came fire, smoke, and sulfur.
By these three things: the fire, smoke, and sulfur which came out of their mouths one third of humanity was killed,
because their power is in their mouth and in their tails. Their tails [are] like snakes with heads, and with these they hurt people.

The rest of the people which were not killed by these plagues, still would not repent of the works of their hands, so that they would not worship devils and idols of gold, silver, brass, stone, and wood, which cannot see, hear, or walk.
Neither would they repent of their murders, sorceries, fornication, nor stealing.
